definition: to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

sentences.english: It also has the first class stadium and some gymnasiums .
sentences.chinese: 擁有國家一類體育場館和數家體育健身場所。

sentences.english: The electronic scoreboard is essential for stadiums and gymnasiums.
sentences.chinese: 電子計分牌是體育場館中不可缺少的重要設備。

sentences.english: Moreover, of the amount spent on the sports venues, the government shoulders only about one-half.
sentences.chinese: 而且，政府只承擔了二分之一的體育場館建設費用。

sentences.english: Mega-sports venues are the support and carriers for sport career development.
sentences.chinese: 大型體育場館是體育事業發展的依託和載體。

sentences.english: Commonality stadium and gymnasia are the substantial guarantee to promote the cause of national sport.
sentences.chinese: 公共體育場館是國家發展體育事業的物質保障。

sentences.english: The construction of stadiums and theaters squanders the government's tight budget.
sentences.chinese: 興建體育場館和劇院等會浪費政府的有限財政。

sentences.english: Many new gymnasiums have emerged in Beijing in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 北京近些年來新建了很多體育場館。

sentences.english: Four langurs each will patrol the two stadiums, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，四隻葉猴每隻巡邏兩個體育場館。

sentences.english: The mud land slide is the size of a couple of stadiums.
sentences.chinese: 在泥地滑是一個體育場館夫婦的大小。

sentences.english: The product quality of high school stadium and gymnasium provided is of half-product.
sentences.chinese: 高校體育場館提供的產品性質是準公共產品。

sentences.english: Bridges, squares, stadiums and theatres were named after him.
sentences.chinese: 橋樑，廣場，體育場館和劇院以他的名字命名。

definition: out with the old and in with the new (idiom)
interregional/spanning two or more PRC provinces
